events.name: The Future of User Experience
events.description: The digital world is at an inflection point and the implications demand that organizations hire designers who are smart generalists. Think about the moment we’re in: mobile, big data and personalization are converging to drive truly novel user experiences across countless new channels and in real life. In this post-screen world, the lines between the physical and the digital blur. It’s a world of experiences, less and less dependent on any one platform, device, interface or technology. Join us on Wednesday, July 8th, for drinks, snacks, and a presentation by VP, User Experience at Huge, Josh Payton, about how the user experience discipline has evolved alongside the digital industry and what implications this has for the future. Location: Huge's office is located at 33 Ann Siang Rd., Suite 31A. When you arrive, please check in with staff at the main building entrance and we'll send you up to the event venue. About the Speaker Josh Payton is VP of User Experience in Huge's European offices, partnering with Huge’s global strategy, design and development teams in the creation and rapid prototyping of concepts, ecosystems, and interfaces. Josh has worked for such clients as Turkish Airlines, Lowe’s, Four Seasons, Amex, Disney and many more in Huge's Brooklyn, Los Angeles and London offices. During his decade-plus of interactive design experience, Josh has acted as the User Experience Design Lead for the home and storefront pages at Amazon.com and as a Senior Designer for Microsoft, Washington Post/Newsweek Interactive and Yahoo! News.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

events.name: Meteor July Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our JulyMeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! *** Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - My Issue with Template Level Subscription - Ken #2 - Avatar package - Duncan Foster #3 - Hacking oAuth - Max #4 - Using React with Meteor - Max Foo #5 - Show & Tell: - Pagination: Ken (maybe) #4 - Meteor Clinic: - We are going to try something new - if anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question ) #5 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: http://singapore.meteor.com/ #6 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: TBC Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Directions: Organizers : Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Venue sponsor: Plug-In@Blk71: http://www2.blk71.com Please contact us to sign up to our newsletter for future events...

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 8th July 2015 7:00pm
events.description: Topic 1: Internet of things (IOT) on Azure with Power BI By Prakash Sawant, Microsoft Singapore Topic 2: Big Data with Azure: concepts and best practices By SQLMaster – Satya Shyam K Jayanty (from UK join us via Skype) Azure has the ability to move, store and analyze data within the cloud. It is essential to evaluate multiple opportunities and options with Microsoft Azure data insights. In this session let us talk about strategies on data storage, data partitioning and availability options with Azure. A tour on how best these Azure components can help you achieve success for your Big Data platform. A short bio about SQLMaster – Satya Shyam K Jayanty:“…A Subject Matter Expert (Technical & Data Architect and DBA) with a vision on Software Architecture, SDLC, database design, development, testing and implementation. Achieved the key results of Software Architecture Solutions by structuring the standards to promote dependability and modifiability, component based software development, aspect oriented architectures, distributed, Intranet and Internet applications. Experienced and interested to work on majority of Microsoft Technologies on the capacity of architecture design and operational practices, having 24+ years of experience in IT field that includes a wide range of industries, including the stock exchange, insurance, tele-communications, financial, insurance, retail, and manufacturing sectors, among others.Microsoft Most Valueable Professional (MVP) (Architecture – SQL Server) since the year 2006 – Author: Microsoft SQL Server 2008 R2 administration cookbook (May 2011) [ http://tinyurl.com/SJ-SQL2K8R2AdminCookBook ] Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Cube Security how-to ( October 2012) [ http://tinyurl.com/sql2012InstantCubeSecurity] from Packt Publishers. Co-Author: MVP Deep Dives Volume II – SQL Server (October 2011) – http://manning.com/delaney from Manning Publications.Involved as a Technical Reviewer and provided foreword for 3 books related to High Availability & Disaster Recovery topics. Worked as Item Writer & Technical Reviewer forSQL Server 2008, 2008 R2 and 2012 Microsoft ITPRO & DEV certification exams.Actively involved getting customers involved in Technology Early Adopters (TAP) from Microsoft who are attentive testing new technologies & features, for instance future releases of SQL Server technologies.A regular Speaker and SME volunteer at major technology conferences such as Microsoft Tech-Ed (Europe, India and North America), SQL PASS (Europe and North America), SQL Bits – UK and manages Scottish Area SQL Server user group based in Scotland. Public speaking engagements and present the subject effectively within short time solutions.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room
